titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Russian subject collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Ron Bulatoff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-03-14T10:11-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid written in: Russian English

change.item: Updated extent and added description of 2017 incremental materials (Sarah Patton).
Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated.
Updated extent statement and date range to include new increment.
Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated.
Revised to update encoding by Samira Bozorgi.
Updated extent statement and date range to include new increment.

physdesc.extent: 59 manuscript boxes, 13 oversize boxes, 1 oversize folder, 10 videocassettes, 16 sound tape reels, 2 sound cassettes, 8 sound discs, memorabilia

did.abstract: Pamphlets, leaflets, serial issues, clippings, other printed matter, correspondence, memoranda, reports, orders, translations, election campaign literature, video and sound recordings, and memorabilia relating to political, social, and economic conditions in Russia, and in the Russian empire as a whole, the Soviet Union as a whole, and the Soviet successor states collectively, and especially to the Russian Revolution and Civil War, American engineers in Russia, and post-1991 elections in Russia.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

Use copies of some video and sound recordings are available for immediate access. To listen to other sound recordings or to view other videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Russian subject collection, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, leaflets, serial issues, clippings, other printed matter, correspondence, memoranda, reports, orders, translations, election campaign literature, video and sound recordings, and memorabilia relating to political, social, and economic conditions in Russia, and in the Russian empire as a whole, the Soviet Union as a whole, and the Soviet successor states collectively, and especially to the Russian Revolution and Civil War, American engineers in Russia, and post-1991 elections in Russia. Video use copies of videocassette available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relates to the activities of the Imperial Russian Life Guard Cuirassier Regiment of His Majesty before and during the Russian Revolution and civil war and to the activities of surviving members in foreign countries after their emigration from Russia. In Russian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Translations of articles and declarations relating to the Narodnaia Volia and other nineteenth century Russian revolutionary parties, including the Partiia Sotsialistov-Revoliutsionerov.

did.unittitle: Rossiisko-amerikanskaia kompaniia [Rossiisko-amerikanskaia kompaniia; Ts Russia R967],

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Laws made by the Russian government to regulate settlements established by the Russian-American Company on the Pacific coast of North America.

did.unittitle: Russo-Japanese War. Clippings from the U.S. press, principally in San Francisco,
Russo-Romanian relations [Russo-Romanian Relations; Vw Romania R425],

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report relating to conversations between an unnamed Russian Grand Duke and a number of Romanian political leaders regarding Romanian foreign policy and Russo-Romanian relations. Written by the Grand Duke and addressed to Tsar Nicolas II.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Writings, reports, pamphlets, leaflets, serial issues, clippings, and printed matter relating to various aspects of Russian culture and history. Includes financial records of the Tea Trade Society (V. Vysotsky and Company). Mainly in Russian.

did.unittitle: Posters, broadsides, and photocopies of newspaper and periodical articles,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relates to the Russian civil war, as well as personnel records, notes, and printed matter, 1819-1924, relating to the Russian Revolution and founding congress of the Communist International. Includes instructions from the Secretariat of the Central Executive Committee of the VKP(b) to persons occupying the Kremlin, circa 1917-1918 [Russia – History – Revolution, 1917-1921]. Mainly in Russian.

did.unittitle: Scrapbook of clippings relating to events in Russia,
Agriculture, "Khlebnaia razverstka" (Bread procurement), data from Volyn' Region,
Atrocities. "The Photographic History of the Bolshevik Atrocities,"
Economic policy, "Kontsessionnaia politika bol'shevikov" (Concessionary Policy of the Bolsheviks),
Posol'skaia incident [Posolskaya incident; Ms DK766 P854],

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Transcripts of testimony, summaries of conferences, declarations, and notes relating to the capture of the armored train of Ataman Grigirii Semenov, White Russian military leader, by the U.S. 27th Infantry Regiment at Posolskaia, Siberia, and to alleged atrocities committed by the troops of Ataman Semenov.

did.unittitle: Post World War I reconstruction. Memorandum by L. Pushchin,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Translated extracts from newspaper articles relating to the Russian civil war. Translated from Arkhangel'sk newspaper.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Orders, memoranda, and correspondence relating to the "icy march" campaign of V. Kappel', White Russian army general, in Siberia during the Russian civil war. In Russian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda and reports relating to the gathering of the harvest that was abandoned by the inhabitants of the Stepno-Badzheiskyi District in 1919. In Russian.

Lincoln concerning Soviet-American relations; excerpts (typewritten carbon copy) from the English translation by Charles Malamuth of the book by L. Trotsky, Stalin: An Appraisal of the Man and His Influence; a newspaper article from La vanguardia española, 1970, by Maria Serrallach concerning the alleged illegitimate daughter of L. Trotsky in Barcelona before the Spanish civil war.

did.unittitle: Camps located on the territory of the Magadan region in the years 1930-1950,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paraphrased legend: This map was compiled with the help of ex-prisoners and civil servants, and declassified KGB documents, which made it possible to find out the exact location of the camps, mines, timber industry, road distances, etc. The map contains about 400 locations, previously parts of the GULAG system. The author of this map is I. Panikarov, Yagodnoe village, Magadan region.

did.unittitle: Propaganda, Anti-American. Clippings from Soviet newspapers,
Posters reflecting various election campaigns, depicting candidates and their programs
2 banners with portrait of Vladimir Lenin
Hat with slogan encouraging people to vote
Pins for presidential candidates Boris Yeltsin and Martin Shakum
4 t-shirts with slogans supporting Boris Yeltsin for president
Belt buckle with hammer and sickle insignia
Shapirov, Saetgali, identification card of the KUZBASS independent miners union and lapel pin with insignia of miners
Oni vybirali svobody, documentary on Soviet dissidents, DVD
Vohon’ i zbroia, on the Ukrainian Insurgent Army, DVD
Turoverskie chteniia, on the modern-day neo-Cossack movement and Cossack history, DVD
Vzgliani v glaza voiny, on the Russian Army in WWI, DVD
Igry bogov, on neo-pagan revivalism, DVD
Vozhd’ i pastyr’, on Stalin and the Orthodox Church, DVD
Three CDs with databases on Stalin’s terror, its victims and perpetrators
Zima ukhodi (labeled “Winter, go away”), documentary on contemporary political opposition, DVD
Chastichnoe pravosudie, on the killing of journalists in the Russian Federation, 1993-2009, DVD

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: One issued by Natsional’no-osvoboditel’noe dvizhenie and the other of unknown origin, but likely also from the radical right.
